conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is greater than 75 meters or less than 75 meters, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows the velocity (v) as a function of time (t). The velocity increases from 0 m/s to 20 m/s over the first 10 seconds, and then decreases to 10 m/s over the next 5 seconds.
The area under the velocity-time graph gives the distance traveled. Therefore, we need to calculate the area under the curve from t = 10 s to t = 15 s.

premise: From t = 10 s to t = 15 s, the velocity decreases linearly from 20 m/s to 10 m/s.
conclusion: The area under the curve from t = 10 s to t = 15 s forms a triangle.
The area of a triangle can be calculated using the formula: Area = (1/2) × base × height.

premise: The base of the triangle is the time interval, which is 15 s - 10 s = 5 s.
conclusion: The base of the triangle is 5 s.

premise: The height of the triangle is the difference in velocity, which is 20 m/s - 10 m/s = 10 m/s.
conclusion: The height of the triangle is 10 m/s.

premise: The base of the triangle is 5 s, and the height of the triangle is 10 m/s.
conclusion: The area of the triangle is (1/2) × 5 s × 10 m/s = 25 m.

premise: The area under the curve from t = 10 s to t = 15 s is 25 m.
conclusion: The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is 25 m.

conclusion: The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is less than 75 m.
